verb.description: (of an area of land or a building) be next to or have a common boundary with.
examples: a park abutting on an area of wasteland

origin: Late Middle English: the sense have a common boundary from Anglo-Latin abuttare, from a- (from Latin ad to, at) + Old French but end; the sense lean upon (late 16th century) from Old French abouter, from a- (from Latin ad to, at) + bouter strike, butt, of Germanic origin.
